title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the 1920s that tells the story of Jay Gatsby's love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality narrated by a young girl.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby-Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that intertwines the lives of private and public individuals during the Napoleonic wars.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that chronicles Odysseus's 10-year struggle to return home after the Trojan War.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel that explores the moral dilemmas of a young student who commits murder.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about teenage angst and alienation, narrated by the iconic character Holden Caulfield.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that delves into ethical debates of God, free will, and morality.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State, where society is kept harmonious by genetic engineering.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel that follows the experiences of the orphaned Jane Eyre as she matures into adulthood.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tragic love story set on the Yorkshire moors, focusing on the turbulent relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem describing Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins in Middle-earth.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy trilogy following the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella reflecting events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel about a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A philosophical novel about a man who remains young and beautiful while his portrait ages and shows his moral corruption.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A gothic horror novel that introduces Count Dracula and his attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem set during the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A story of an innocent man wrongfully imprisoned who escapes and seeks revenge on his enemies.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A novel set in post-revolutionary France, following the lives and interactions of several characters, particularly ex-convict Jean Valjean.
